author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Bruhat Bangalore Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is once again in the news for releasing funds out of turn, reportedly to favour four Congress MLAs, alleged former councillor N.R. Ramesh.

He alleged that around Rs. 155 crore had been released for various infrastructure works between July 2015 and January 2016 in violation of the seniority rule.

He alleged that MLAs from Rajarajeshwarinagar, K.R. Puram, Yeshwantpur and Byatarayanapura had pressured officials to release bills of contractors, all Congress supporters, out of turn. “There are contractors who have been waiting for payment for works executed over the past 22 months. If the seniority rule had been followed, pending bills till December 2014 could have been cleared,” he claimed. Mr. Ramesh also alleged that only 50 per cent of the 599 works in the four constituencies had been executed. He claimed to have lodged a complaint with the Bangalore Metropolitan Task Force and in the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate Court.
title: ‘BBMP released bills out of turn, favoured four MLAs’
